title: Define Project Requirements - Updated
description: Gather and document the functional and non-functional requirements for the Interactive Code Playground project. This includes user interface design, API endpoints (with specific examples), database schema (with entity relationship diagram), security considerations (including authentication/authorization mechanisms), performance benchmarks (with expected response times and scalability goals), and accessibility guidelines. Also, outline the expected workflow for users, collaboration features, and real-time communication features.

title: Design System Architecture - InteractiveCodePlayground (Revised)
description: This RFC details the design of the overall system architecture for the InteractiveCodePlayground project. The following aspects are covered: frontend, backend, and database components; communication protocols, data flow, integration points with third-party services, scalability and performance considerations, microservices architecture for a modular and maintainable solution, security, usability, and accessibility best practices. Additionally, this RFC includes a detailed design document that outlines these aspects. Please note that this task depends on the completion of 'Define Project Requirements' and 'Identify External Dependencies and Integrations'.

title: Develop Frontend
description: Implement the user interface and client-side functionality for the Interactive Code Playground.

title: Develop Backend
description: Implement the server-side functionality, including code execution, collaboration features, and API endpoints.

title: Set up Database
description: Design and implement the database schema for storing user data, code snippets, and collaboration sessions.

title: Implement Security Measures
description: Ensure the application is secure by implementing authentication, authorization, input validation, and other security best practices.

title: Set up Continuous Integration and Deployment
description: Configure a CI/CD pipeline for automated testing, building, and deploying the application to various environments.

title: Write Documentation
description: Create comprehensive documentation for the project, including user guides, developer guides, and API documentation.

title: Test and Quality Assurance
description: Plan and execute various testing strategies, including unit testing, integration testing, and end-to-end testing, to ensure the application meets the defined requirements and quality standards.

title: Deploy and Monitor
description: Deploy the application to production and set up monitoring and logging systems to track its performance and identify potential issues.
dependencies: Set up Continuous Integration and Deployment
